API Documentation¶

class pydebruijn.DeBruijnPoly(*args)¶

Class for generating de Bruijn sequences with product of irreducible polynomials.

This class can be used without importing SymPy, as it accepts binary strings which it then internally converts into polynomials.

Parameters:args (binary string(s)) – Polynomials to be used to generate de Bruijn sequences. Input polynomials must be irreducible; reducible polynomials are silently ignored. Coefficients are given in decreasing power – e.g. x**3 + x + 1 is written as 1011.
adjacency_matrix¶

Returns the adjacency matrix of the connectivity graph.

fsr¶

Returns the FeedbackShiftRegister object corresponding to the current sequence.

See also

FeedbackShiftRegister

next_sequence()¶

Changes the parameters of the generator to generate a different sequence.

Raises:StopIteration – If the connectivity graph has yielded all possible spanning trees.
order¶

Returns the degree of the sequence’s generating polynomial.

Equivalent to .poly.degree().

poly¶

Returns the sequence’s generating polynomial.

Equivalent to multiplying the elements of .polys together.

polys¶

Returns the list of polynomials used in constructing the sequence generator.

state¶

Returns the current state of the feedback shift register.

class pydebruijn.DeBruijnZech(p, t)¶

Class for generating de Bruijn sequences using Zech’s logarithms.

This class uses stored Zech’s logarithm values, as it is rather expensive to compute them on the fly.

Parameters:
  • p (Sympy.Poly object) – A primitive binary polynomial.
  • t (integer) – The decimation value to be applied to p. If p is of degree n, this value must necessarily divide 2**n - 1, but this is not a sufficient requirement.
adjacency_matrix¶

Returns the adjacency matrix of the connectivity graph.

fsr¶

Returns the FeedbackShiftRegister object corresponding to the current sequence.

See also

FeedbackShiftRegister

next_sequence()¶

Changes the parameters of the generator to generate a different sequence.

Raises:StopIteration – If the connectivity graph has yielded all possible spanning trees.
order¶

Returns the degree of the sequence’s generating polynomial.

Equivalent to .poly.degree().

poly¶

Returns the sequence’s generating polynomial.

Equivalent to applying t-decimation to p.

state¶

Returns the current state of the feedback shift register.

class pydebruijn.FeedbackShiftRegister(anf, order=None, init_state=None)¶

Class for implementing feedback shift registers.

This class does not check for validity of its inputs. Users may invoke the constructor but must take care to provide valid inputs.

advance()¶

Advances the current state of feedback shift register by one step.

See also

next_state()

anf¶

Returns the algebraic normal form of the feedback shift register.

Returns:anf – The algebraic normal form as a SymPy expression.
Return type:algebraic normal form

See also

modified_anf

anf_degree¶

Returns the degree of the algebraic normal form.

Returns:degree – The degree of the algebraic normal form.
Return type:integer

See also

anf

bit()¶

Returns the next bit of feedback shift register.

This method modifies the current state of the feedback shift register as a side-effect.

This method is synonymous with fsr.next_state()[-1].

Returns:next_bit – The next bit of the feedback shift register.
Return type:list

See also

next_state()

modified_anf¶

Returns the algebraic normal form of the feedback shift register with the zero cycle removed, if present, and vice-versa.

Returns:mod_anf – The modified algebraic normal form.
Return type:algebraic normal form

See also

anf

modified_anf_degree¶

Returns the degree of the modified algebraic normal form.

Returns:degree – The degree of the modified algebraic normal form.
Return type:integer

See also

modified_anf

next_state()¶

Returns the state after the current state of the feedback shift register.

This method modifies the current state of the feedback shift register as a side-effect.

Returns:next_state – The next state of the feedback shift register.
Return type:list

See also

advance()

order¶

Returns the order of the algebraic normal form.

The order of a feedback shift register is also the size of its state.

Returns:order – The order of the algebraic normal form.
Return type:integer
sequence()¶

Returns the full sequence of the feedback shift register.

Do keep the order of the feedback shift register in mind, as this method will try to return the entire sequence, no matter how big it is.

Returns:sequence – The full sequence of the feedback shift register.
Return type:list
state¶

Returns the current state of the algebraic normal form.

Returns:state – The state of the algebraic normal form. Its elements are always only 0s and 1s.
Return type:list

Module containing helper functions assisting the main classes.

These helper functions fall into six categories:

  • algebraic normal form functions
  • binary polynomial functions
  • boolean function functions
  • graph functions
  • Zech’s logarithm functions
  • miscellaneous functions
